creator: liyanage@access.ch
text:
There should be an option to *never* clobber existing files in operations
like copy or move, even if the source files are newer. This would be very
useful in install targets to protect config files which the user usually
edits by hand.
Going by the modification date is not good enough, because the sample
config files or templates might be newer, but that's no reason to replace
the customized files already present.

A possibility would be a new value for the overwrite attribute (like "never") or a new 
attribute.

creator: holtdl@yahoo.com
text:
I think the new <filesmatch> condition and the <input> task, in combination 
with if/unless on <include>/<exclude> to dynamically gen the set of files to 
copy/move, would probably be better a way of dealing with this sort of thing 
than a "neveroverwrite". (Just because a config or template file already 
exists, doesn't necessarily mean it's been locally modified.)
